website_summaries.verdict: A wealth of new content and gameplay additions make a modern role-playing classic better than ever in Persona 4 Golden.
pros: Distinctive mix of resource management and role playingMemorable characters and fantastic dialogueMakes a substantial number of improvements to the interface and combatLots of new locations and events give great incentive for old fans to returnThoughtful, engaging mystery story keeps you enthralled
cons: Takes a few hours to get going

customer_reviews.title: Your social life will slowly disappear
customer_reviews.text: Just so you know this game should not be rated M in fact I really think it could be something like E 10 and up. This is one of my favorite games off all time and I used to play it for hours on my ps2. I saw that this game was remastered for the ps Vita and I went out and got a ps Vita just so I could play this beautiful game. I have over 327 hours of gameplay and will continue to play it some more. I didn't even mean to play it this much it just happened but be careful, as soon as you play this game your social life will slowly disappear.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Baron

customer_reviews.title: Golden
customer_reviews.text: I'm really new with the Persona universe. I've heard good things about this and I was recommended to try it because I love JRPG games. When I first tried the game, I was hooked. I couldn't stop playing this game. The game is awesome. The graphics, the music, the battle system, the gameplay and the story. Everything about this game is perfect. If you are a JRPG fan like me, I would definitely check this game out. I have a blast playing this game. I've probably spend over 50+ hours of playing the game. It's just that good. I can't stress enough to recommend this game and definitely a must have title for the PSVita. Two Thumbs Up
customer_reviews.author: Sol David Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: The Story
customer_reviews.text: I was astonished at the fact that this game has a 4.8 star rating. I've only played for maybe a couple hours and I can safely back that rating. I played the second one as a kid and remembering it having a great story, and Persona 5 is just as captivating. I still haven't beaten it after having it for over a year because I don't want it to end, and I have a feeling I'll feel the same with this one. Besides Final Fantasy X/X-2, I haven't been interested in ANY PS Vita games. I'm glad I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: YggdrasilYggy

customer_reviews.title: Incredible game.
customer_reviews.text: I played Persona 5, hated it. Could not get into it and I was so annoyed that everyone was telling me it was the rpg of our generation. Then i was told to try this and it was on sale on amazon for 15 dollars so I said sure let’s go for it. I immediately fell in love with it and dumped 130 hours into this. The characters and the story are so captivating that it convinced me to try Persona 5 again, and I’m happy it did because I fell MORE in love with Persona 5. Don’t miss this game.
customer_reviews.author: ZMan1993

customer_reviews.title: Love this game
customer_reviews.text: Love this game! I had been wanting to get it for a while and I was super excited to play. The story is wonderful as all Persona games are, and the art is beautiful; so are the graphics. The battle portions are fun even though they can be hard. Grinding for levels doesnt feel like a chore. The rain function for rescue is interesting and a new concept for me. The only thing I would have to complain about is the lack of SP items. It frustrates me to high heaven trying to find some. (I heard that later on in the game it wont be an issue though)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Where Have You Been All My Life?
customer_reviews.text: I love RPGs, but somehow, I managed to miss out on the Persona series until I played and finished Persona 5 this year. Persona 4 was Atlus’ gold egg laying goose (if the spin-offs didn’t tip you off), and I was determined to experience it. Experience I did, and I’m having so much fun. I’m about 30 hours in and I’m having an amazing time. Now, I need to ask: Why am I just getting to this?
customer_reviews.author: Bianca

customer_reviews.title: Persona 4 Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent game, one of my favorite of the series. Long enjoyable story with twist and turns, decent gameplay in a familar style, great characters to interact with in the nice countryside town of Inaba. Music is so good you'll be singing the tunes in your head when you're done playing wanting to go back as soon as you can. Very enjoyable game that can easily yield you two playthroughs and high replayability. Get it now!
customer_reviews.author: Wraith

customer_reviews.title: Every day's great at your Junes!
customer_reviews.text: Persona 4 is a cross between a high school sim and a dungeon crawler RPG. Arriving as a new student, our hero must make his way through high school, meeting new people, joining clubs, and solving a murder mystery that involves a hidden world full of dungeons to navigate and monsters to fight. Fortunately you've got your loyal band of friends to help you out. Fun, likeable characters, a positive tone, good music and sharp art make this a very enjoyable experience all around.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Acheson

customer_reviews.title: Not Just a Great Vita Game, but Great on Any Console
customer_reviews.text: I've never been a huge fan of JRPGs, but I have been blown away by this game. The story, character depth, gameplay, and music are awesome. I can't believe the developers were able to cram so much into a vita game. This game alone justifies owning a Vita. It took me a while to figure out how everything with the Personas worked and almost accidentally got rid of some of the high level ones, but eventually got it sorted. As a hobbyist game developer, this is the sort of game I'm always striving to make.
customer_reviews.author: Jaykron

customer_reviews.title: The definitive P4
customer_reviews.text: Let's face it ... the PS2 is pretty oldschool right about now. And while the Vita may be on its last legs, it's still an amazing and ridiculously underrated handheld. P4 Golden takes the original game and adds an additional scenario, as well as some new music and other assets. Beyond that, it's Persona 4, which is one of the best RPGs of yester-decade. Absolutely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Addicted
customer_reviews.text: My friend recommended this to me and I'm so glad she did. I fell in love with this game. Fun, dark, interactive story. I already have 60 hours into it and there is still alot more to do. Gameplay is good and take a lil while to get the hang of, but it's not that complicated.
customer_reviews.author: pokedbz1691

customer_reviews.title: One of the best RPG I have ever played
customer_reviews.text: Hands down, one of the best rpg I have EVER played. Took me almost 100 hours to complete this game the first play through...At the end I have only collected 75-80% of all the personas. Lots of trophies that you can receive as well. The game can be a bit confusing at first if this is your first persona game(like me) but, once you better understand the fusing process and the benefit of social links, you'll really enjoy this game. This game isn't like most I have played...the choices you make in this game will determine your ending...so be wise. :) I recommend you to follow a guide and start off in easy or normal mode.
customer_reviews.author: melissa

customer_reviews.title: Best of the Best of Vita
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt, the best game on the Vita. If you have a Vita, I highly recommend playing this. I got 60 hours out of the game before I got bored, and I only got about 30% of the trophies. Plenty to do, great replayability (and a New Game + mode), great combat, and interesting characters/stories.
customer_reviews.author: Megaslushboy

customer_reviews.title: Persona 4 but it's golden
customer_reviews.text: Go back into the nostalgic town of Inaba in this remake of the original Persona 4, except now it's portable. Journey with you classmates in uncovering the mystery behind the serial murders in Inaba with the help of your very own P E R S O N A. I give this 9/10 Drunk Rise-chans
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Clark

customer_reviews.title: because I have a lot of love for the original P4 game
customer_reviews.text: I went through the effort of getting a PS Vita almost solely for the sake of playing this game, because I have a lot of love for the original P4 game, and for P3P before it, and I've got to say it was absolutely worth it. This game comes with LOADS more content, not just in terms of the extra months of gameplay you get at the end, but all the new characters, features, and mini cutscenes you get right from the beginning! If you like P4, this game is absolutely worth buying for the extra content, even if you've played through P4 before, as I have.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Rivenbark

customer_reviews.title: Great~ I have to talk to people... oh, okay!
customer_reviews.text: A good 20 hours into the game, and character development in this game is very strong. Before I started the game, I always thought that having to make conversation with in-game characters would be a drag. Turns out, these characters are very likable in their own way! Almost makes me wish I could talk to people like this in real life. Anyways, the ability to smoothly switch players between different realities is greatly handled, and though there's many things to keep track of, you'll find yourself getting used to knowing what to do. This game is very good for the vita since it's easy to just drop in and out of the game while still staying interested in the story
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Awesomeeee!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've played Persona 5, but Persona 4 Golden is waaaaay better (in my opinion). Much more spoken dialogue (woo!! less reading!), more immediate character development, and they did the detective theme better than the justice one... I 100% recommend Golden over its original. Chie's voice change was for the best (again, my opinion) and there are simply more scenes. I just play this game on a PSTV and it's the same as playing Persona 4 on a PS to a television system. Awesome Game. Awesome Story. Awesome Characters. Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Akechi

customer_reviews.title: Golden is in the title for a valid reason. It is golden!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best portable gaming story you can ever experience on a portable device. I don't want to say too much about the game and give spoilers away so I will just say that this game offers real depth that most games lack.This game is worth buying a PS Vita by itself. It is an incredibly visualizing game that will retain in your memory, like Zelda: TOoT. Stunning graphics. Breath-taking story. Immersive game play. If you don't even own a PlayStation Vita you should consider purchasing one just to play this game!
customer_reviews.author: TheOne

customer_reviews.title: Possibly one of my favorite games ever
customer_reviews.text: Possibly one of my favorite games ever!! 10/10. A must have for any rpg fan. Gameplay is fun, graphics top notch for games at the time. Soundtrack is snazzy and exciting, characters are lovable and the story is amazing. Many different activities and possibilities in the game for you to explore. Excellent replay value, new things to be discovered/accomplished in new game+. Don't sleep on this game!!
customer_reviews.author: luci

customer_reviews.title: Persona!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a PS Vita for a road trip this summer, and this was my first game for the platform. I was a little skeptical, I've never been one for turn based combat, but the reviews were so great I gave it a chance. THIS GAME IS AMAZING!! The story, the music, the dialogue, the gameplay. And there is definitely replay value. If you own a PS Vita-you need to buy this game.
customer_reviews.author: Ellethwen

customer_reviews.title: I wish they made this version available to more than a vita
customer_reviews.text: It's Persona, if you haven't played it you should try one. All of the stories are really good if you like a little bit of Japanese culture. Gameplay is a step forward and a step back in someways. They've made it easier and more accessible by eliminating some RNG elements but lost some of the cool things that were in Persona 3 regarding dungeon's. The happy mood of this series is great and I believe that there is values in this game that describes life from different perspectives if you want to look deeply. Play this game and then play persona 5 where they really stepped up the style.
customer_reviews.author: Jian

customer_reviews.title: My favorite videogame of all time!
customer_reviews.text: This is legitimately my favorite videogame of all time, I recommend it so so so much. It changed my life! Everything about it is great, from the characters to the music. Please try it, I know you'll love it!
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Castro Araya

customer_reviews.title: I really like this game
customer_reviews.text: This game is really entertaining, and the story and pacing are excellent. What surprised me the most was the level of the voice acting, it's a really great selection of voices for the characters and their acting was awesome, though there is this one thing that keeps bugging me: voice actors should pronounce Japanese names correctly, not as English speakers think these foreign names ought to be pronounced, otherwise it sounds too weird and disrupts the player's immersion within the game. Other than that (and perhaps the trippy opening), everything in this game was done in an wonderful manner.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique

customer_reviews.title: Persona
customer_reviews.text: The series with it's cult following enters the Golden era with the this entry. The game is perfectly suited to the portable platform with its non-typical layout. With focus on building relationships outside dungeons, you get to know each character. Those relationships build into statistics for your characters Personas. While this game is not perfect, it does pull you into its world to unravel the mysteries of the Midnight Channel. The music score is a mixed bag, but fits the overall theme of the title. If you are on the fence about this title, I would recommend grabbing it for $20.
customer_reviews.author: James P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Port
customer_reviews.text: This game reignited my hope for Playstation Vita. Graphics style is amazing for the feel. Mechanics were overall polished and a lot of frustrating elements back in P4 or P3P are gone. Storyline is absolutely mind-blowing with coherent side-plots (something I was slightly disappointed of in P3P). Music is definitely refined and amazing with both nostalgic tracks from the P3 days and the newer ones just for P3G (Namely title song "Shadow World"). I will not add on to praises in the other review and I don't rate products that often but... Game of the Year, Definitely
customer_reviews.author: LiJiaren

customer_reviews.title: If you own a PS Vita, you HAVE TO have this game
customer_reviews.text: This was the first game I bought for my PS Vita, and this has been one of my favorite games I've ever played. All of the characters have life and are provided with diverse characteristics and backstories, and the game allows you to formulate your own unique gaming experience. I can go on forever about how great this game is. Take my word for it, this game is worth every penny and will keep you happy and entertained for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Noel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Game
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed this game, and it is one of the first RPG games I have devoted so much time to in years. The only thing I thought was lame was if you want to beat the game with 100% you HAVE to play through more than once, and even then you will probably require a walk-through. The game uses a calender type day-to-day system and you can actually miss necessary elements of the game if you do not access them before a certain date and you will simply end up out of luck. Other than the annoyances you will face trying to go for 100% the game is great though! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: Your Favorite Color

customer_reviews.title: Persona
customer_reviews.text: Never thought I'd play a handheld game in my life. Hatter them in fact well they're just not my cup of tea really. Untill this little game Persona 4 golden pops up across look at this section. I almost didn't get it because of the dreadful dungeon crawling but the story seems great. Also the biggest thing that made me buy is the bear. If I were to crique this game about anything is the dungeons crawling needs to be more fun instead of running floor to floor door to door. Either way buy this game it's now one of my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Oldtailedfox

customer_reviews.title: Very engaging story with improved graphics from PS1 version!!!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a story driven but developers were very in tune to mess with what worked and tweaked and improved the game 1. Graphics are break taking on the PSVita and nice almost seamless integration with the animated series with cut scenes...my only grip about this (minor albeit) is the length sometimes reminds me of Metal Gear Solid where I feel in some ways I am watching a movie rather than playing it. 2. Nice work on music and ability to change different tracks was wise. Overall superb job, I have not finished it and I feel I am addicted to the gameplay (there is a lot of gameplay).
customer_reviews.author: Jacobite

customer_reviews.title: Per... so... na...
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love Persona 4, I play it non stop. Persona is one of those hidden gems that barely anyone knows about. I'm glad that this is so much different than Call of Duty because I was getting tired of seeing commercials for it. It's one of those games that has a great story, characters and multiple endings. Oh, I forgot to include AN AWESOME SOUNDTRACK, the music is incredible it goes with Persona 3, its so catchy. I recommend it for anyone who missed out on this on its ps2 day and who owns a vita. Its a must buy for any gamer. I am thou and Thou art I... get it now.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and fun addition to your Vita library!
customer_reviews.text: I own about 30 games for my PS Vita, and I admit I was skeptical when I purchased this game that it would live up to the hype and raving reviews. I'm glad I bought it now, because this is most definitely my favorite Vita title. The story is engaging and entertaining, and the battle system is clean, and very fun!! I've never played any other Persona game, so I have no comparison, but I was able to jump right in and enjoy this game. Well worth the asking price. I would pay full retail for it again without hesitation!
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: The best game for me in the last five years
customer_reviews.text: Before I played the game starting in 2015, I know it has received a lot of acclaims. But I didn't took these good reviews seriously, because I think it is more personal experience. But when I actually play it this far (one year and a half), I totally fall in love with the game. It is truly a masterpiece! And it is the best JRPG that I've ever played and also the best game for me in the last five years. The storyline, characters, and music are almost perfectly good. I bought a PS TV just for playing this game and it really worth it. Strongly recommend it to everyone who wants to play the best JRPG.
customer_reviews.author: li yan

customer_reviews.title: Can't get P5, so I got the next best thing, and...
customer_reviews.text: I'm so sad that I can't play Persona 5 yet, (as I don't have a PS3, PS4, etc...) so I decided to get the other game I was interested in from the series, Persona 4 Golden. So far, this game has been so fun, and I've been playing it everyday since I got it. The beginning starts off slow, but once you get farther it gets to everything else the game has to offer. P4G is well worth it, and I really recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: *Nova*

customer_reviews.title: The first game I played on Vita and it's the best.
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best PS Vita game out there and the high reviews on Amazon and everywhere else has its reasons. You should trust the reviews this time. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: sarahc91

customer_reviews.title: BEST GAME ON VITA
customer_reviews.text: I bought a vita last year and this game was highly recommended but I didn't have a clue what this game was. Once I started I couldn't put my vita down,it hooked me as I love rpg and especially well written characters. I'm in love with this game and franchise (I went played Persona 3 and 2, the animation TV series). I'm eagerly waiting on Persona 5 and while I wait I keep revisiting this one to make the wait a bit easier.
customer_reviews.author: AKA

customer_reviews.title: My first Persona game and I LOVE it!!
customer_reviews.text: My first Persona game and I LOVE it!! I started this and Persona 5 close together ( I know thats strange), and they are very similar in game play. Even though 5 has better graphics, 4 has a much better story. It works great on the PSTV.
customer_reviews.author: Robert the Great

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite JRPGs
customer_reviews.text: Words can't really even describe how fantastic this game is. If you like slice-of-life/dungeon crawler RPGs, this is definitely a game you have to get. Huge variety in the personalities of the characters make them seem real. Writing is great, and it feels like there are tons more to do in the game compared to Persona 3. Not to mention a 40-50 hour playthrough which begs it to be played through a second time for completion-sake.
customer_reviews.author: M. Heim

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Upgraded Port
customer_reviews.text: Persona 4 Golden improves on the original in practically every way. Marie may not have been the best character, but I feel that her addition to the game was still done in good taste. P4G is easily the best game I have played on the Vita, and is absolutely one of the best JRPGs ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Vincent

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING GAME
customer_reviews.text: Received it very quickly. I had never played any of the persona games but as i looked at lists for "must own vita games" this game always appeared on them. So i decided to give it a try and I was hooked on it. It was a lengthy game but it never really seemed to feel like it dragged except for a few parts. This is a GREAT game and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE the Perona and Shin Megami Tensei series
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE the Perona and Shin Megami Tensei series! For those who crave an immersive RPG experience that holds; Amazing combat, Fantastic story telling, Character development, Phenomenal Soundtrack, and more, this is the game you cannot refuse.
customer_reviews.author: mariano g.

customer_reviews.title: A great remake to a great game
customer_reviews.text: A great remake to a great game. While its a retelling of Persona 4 for the PlayStation 2 and mostly unchanged, it features new characters, such as Marie, and a variety of new Quests and Costumes to be worn by every character in the game, ranging from normal to sexy to funny. The story is deep and may make you question your own life and attitude.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee May Ferenczi

customer_reviews.title: This is easily the best game on the vita for any RPG ...
customer_reviews.text: Never played a persona game till this one. This is easily the best game on the vita for any RPG fan , even you people that like action games would enjoy this. All the text is voiced. Near perfect game . I highly recommend it You'll also learn stuff I learned in my intro to psychology in high school , which is pretty cool
customer_reviews.author: Consumer_Zombie

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: I got this game at the recommendation of a friend. I wasn't sure I'd like it, but it wound up being one of my favorite games, and the one to turn me on to the Persona series. This is a really, really great video game, and one with an outstanding plot. The characters are well-developed and believable. I for one am a fan of turn-based battles and JRPGs, so this was great.
customer_reviews.author: hapaxlegomena

customer_reviews.title: Great Game
customer_reviews.text: Bought for collection purposes I already had this game at one point and beat it but lost it. This game is amazing the story is good and the characters are funny. if you like RPG games and Mystery this is a good one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Bought a vita just for this game; exceeded expectations.
customer_reviews.text: As a long time persona fan and player of the original P4, I wasn't sure about buying a new system to play a game I had already played before. I don't regret my decision even a little, P4G has loads of new content and gameplay. As someone who failed to play through P4 even a second time, P4G has me hooked into the same game even stronger than when I played the original. It has tons of replay value and fun features. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Proxy

customer_reviews.title: Interesting
customer_reviews.text: It's a fun game with a ton of things to do, well worth it. A PlayStation Vita Must Buy!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: so Cool
customer_reviews.text: A lot of reviews are saying how good and amazing this game is and i'm also boarding that train. this is the first time i've played this game and i'll admit that fighting my first boss was annoying since my level was too low. but now that i have an understanding of it...i do see why everyone likes it so much. it is fun, addicting and totally random (if it's your first time playing it like in my case). i don't regret this purchase. 2 thumbs up
customer_reviews.author: Shikigami78

customer_reviews.title: Best version of this classic
customer_reviews.text: I've watched the Giant Bomb Endurance run of this game and have played the PS2 version so this game holds an endearing place in my heart. The extra content and additonal after game chapter makes it well worth the re-purchase price. Marie's character is well integrated into the story and I enjoyed her story arc. I've played this game for over 100 hours now and ths is the first game I've ever made it my goal to 100 percent and get the platinnum trophy. A MUST BUY FOR ANY PERSONA OR JRPG FAN!!!
customer_reviews.author: Hip-Hop Anonymouse

customer_reviews.title: Awesome game and a great step up from the original
customer_reviews.text: I had already played the Persona 4 game for the Playstation 2 and was eager to try The Golden once I got a Vita. I have only beaten this game on normal mode so far, but the additions to the game make it worth it even if you've already played the original game. The extra story modes are fun and there was more new content than I expected so I was very pleased with this game. It ran smoothly, graphics are great, battle system is awesome, and the story is entertaining. I am a big fan of the Persona series and if you are too, I'd recommend this game.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: Persona 4 was one of my favorite games growing up
customer_reviews.text: Persona 4 was one of my favorite games growing up. The golden edition is the definitive edition. There are a few changes that I was not expecting but the product is still as good as I remember the original being, albeit now in HD.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Wesker

customer_reviews.title: Amazing game if you like the series or RPGs in ...
customer_reviews.text: I could justify buying a PS Vita just to play this game (and maybe Tearaway as well). Amazing game if you like the series or RPGs in general. Not really into all the other weird anime games on the Vita, they just feel like extended inside jokes from a corresponding book/show, and seem to largely have stale mechanics. P4G on the other hand is extremely polished in every way, great soundtrack, lots of freedom to choose the course of your playthrough, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Dan C

customer_reviews.title: Persona 4 Golden - awesome RPG
customer_reviews.text: This is a very interesting role playing game, with lots of dialogues, some choices, and good turn-based battles. It seems to start slow, but then the pace picks up and you play against a deadline (fog settling in the real world). The game can be saved only at certain savepoints, there are none in the "dungeon", but you can escape the "dungeon" and then save. Very addictive!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Persona!!! Truly is Golden!
customer_reviews.text: Just buy the game, trust me any JRPG or RPG enthusiast will love this game. Its one of those special games you will remember forever. Excellent Characters, Excellent Story, Excellent Music, Excellent Voice Acting, and a Superb combat system. I regret not playing this sooner, Heck its worth buying a Vita for this game alone.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus

customer_reviews.title: J-RPG at its best
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful RPG game with great story line and wonderful character building. That's what's missing with a lot of "western" RPG, which focused too much on all the "open world" and World of Warcraft like quests overload. Japanese RPG focuses on story telling and character development. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Icedlatte

customer_reviews.title: Must have for Vita owners & JRPG fans.
customer_reviews.text: Must have game for JRPG fans, & PS Vita owners. Just bought my vita & only could buy one game initially, it was an ez choice, had to have P4 Golden 1st. After you thoroughly enjoy P4, you can purchase P5 on PS4 & use remote play to play on your vita while away from home.
customer_reviews.author: MATFINK

customer_reviews.title: Thanks Amazon :)
customer_reviews.text: Ordered directly from Amazon and is exactly what I was looking for! Can't wait to play it on my new PS Vita Slim. Was so excited to see this offered by Amazon that I ordered a PS Vita memory card. I'm so excited!
customer_reviews.author: ShopaholicTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Stop reading, start buying
customer_reviews.text: One of best games I have ever played. On the same level as KOTOR, Jade Empire, etc. This game made the PS Vita purchase worth it. You do have to truly----truly---play this game with headphones on to appreciate not only the music in the game, but to appreciate how good music in a game could be. The characters are entertaining and interesting. You will find yourself emotionally invested in what is going on in their lives. The turn-based combat is easily understandable but challenging at the same time. The music deserves awards. Movies could learn from this game's plot which has a mix of comedy, mystery, action and more. Stop reading, stary buying.
customer_reviews.author: Deuce

customer_reviews.title: The Vita's best game!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought the vita for a completely different game, but I can definitely say that Persona 4 Golden is easily the best game for the system. If you're a fan of RPG's but are growing tired of the more mainstream titles like Final Fantasy, then Persona is a great place to turn to. The gameplay and story is already very engaging with lovable characters to add, but also the soundtrack, i'd say, is one of the best in video games period. The Persona series has instantly become one of my favorites and I'm eagerly awaiting the next installment. Any vita owner who doesn't have this game is doing themselves a great disservice.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: The game runs smoothly and is still amazingly fun, even though I had already played it on ...
customer_reviews.text: I ADORE this game. I played Persona 4 on the Playstation 2, so I was extremely excited to get another version on the Vita. The game runs smoothly and is still amazingly fun, even though I had already played it on another system. The story holds up well and some new pieces were added that kept things fresh. It did seem a little easier than the PS2 version, but you can always choose the hardest difficulty to get around that I'm sure. I definitely recommend this game!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Cooper-Whitley

customer_reviews.title: Best game on the Vita
customer_reviews.text: This game is phenomenal. Having played the previous installment to the franchise, Persona 3: FES, this game not only expands upon the original game's framework, it refines and perfects errors held in the older games. The characters feel real, the combat is interesting and exciting, and the music just makes the game shine. Add on to that a (literal) year's worth of content, and you have yourself one of the best game experiences I've had to date. It's not for everyone - people that want a deep combat system and less text will most likely be disappointed - but even then it's at least worth a shot. Persona 4: Golden is a title your Vita needs to have.

product_meta.title: Persona 4 Golden - PlayStation Vita
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Following in the footsteps of Persona 3 Portable, the second highest rated PSP game of all time, and based on Persona 4, one of the most beloved ATLUS titles ever, P4G delivers an enhanced and expanded portable roleplaying experience. Visuals have been beautifully remastered to take advantage of the vibrant 5" OLED display. The game's aural presentation is better than ever, with 1.5 times the voiced dialogue of the original release. A new online dungeon rescue feature allows users to call on other players for assistance when they are about to die in the TV world. P4G is also overflowing with new content: new Personas to collect; new story events along with an all new character; stunning new anime cut scenes, which include a new opening animation with a new song from master composer Shoji Meguro; a host of fan suggested tweaks and changes, and much, much more! Persona 4 Golden is far more than just a handheld version of an all-time classic: it's the best way to experience it yet!
feature_bullets: A bigger, better version of one of the best RPGs ever: Improved visuals, tons of new story and voiced dialogue, and much more combine with deep turn-based combat, addicting character and Persona management, and a memorable cast of personalities.

Make meaningful bonds with characters via social links: In between its exploration, battles, and Persona management, P4G lets players choose how they wish to spend their time each day in a variety of different activities.
Will you uncover the true ending to the story? Nearly 100 hours of gameplay thrusts you into a deep mystery where midnight television leads to serial killings
